p: Other comparisons would have been possible (one thinks of the introduction into clinical practice of “discussed” molecules such as cinchona, antimony, or arsphenamine), other authors could have been called upon in medical anthropology (like Byron J. Good, from Harvard Medical School, and his work in the field of professional and individual acceptance and dissemination of treatment for mental illness), but this article is intended as a first approach, a first look, a strong introduction.
